final_answer.precision_note: 3 significant figures from current/time and molar mass data -> mass(Cu)=0.889 g.

method: Find the total charge passed from current and time using Q = It. Convert that to moles of electrons with n(e−)=Q/F. Use the cathode half-reaction Cu2+ + 2e− → Cu, so moles of copper deposited are half the moles of electrons. Multiply by molar mass of copper to obtain the mass.
